description: This trap is sent when the ECMG Group fails (i.e.
the last ECMG channel in the group has failed).
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-SIMULCRYPT-MIB::cerVideoSimCrEcmgConnection CADANT-CMTS-EQUIPMENT-MIB::trapCounter c 9999 CADANT-CMTS-EQUIPMENT-MIB::trapSeverity i 1 ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-SIMULCRYPT-MIB::cerSimCrTrapScsIndex i 0 ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-SIMULCRYPT-MIB::cerSimCrTrapSuCasId u 9999 ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-SIMULCRYPT-MIB::cerSimCrTrapErrorStr s EXAMPLE

description: This is the trap sequence number that increments each
time a trap is sent. It is persistent across resets.
variables.name: CADANT-CMTS-EQUIPMENT-MIB::trapCounter

description: Severity level of a Cadant trap.

description: Description of error.

description: This trap is sent when an ECMG channel fails (i.e.
goes down and does not come up again immediately).
The IP address and TCP port are for the remote ECMG.

description: This trap is sent when the number of blocked streams in an SCS
has changed in the last reporting interval. The trap count is the
Current number of blocked streams due to Simulcrypt problems in that SCS.

event.Summary: The number of blocked streams in a SCS has Changed
